column4: Hey guys i need to change a setting in user/group in the admin panel but everything is greyed out/not letting me click anything plz help
Hey guys i need to change a setting in user/group in the admin panel but everything is greyed out/not letting me click anything plz help
How do i do administrative tasks do i have to log into root how
if you need power, put sudo at the start of the command
forget about root alltogether and you'll be fine
im trying to change seting in user/group setting it doesent let me
then use gksudo <program name>
im trying to change setting in administrator user/group settings
any idea
what command do you run to get the app up?
i click system-administration-users and groups and then click root then manage groups
its user settings
it doesent let me change anything
any idea
i'd check what app that runs, then try gksudo <app name>
how do i check what app it runs
you could edit the menu to check the command line
what do you mean
the ownership my pass from the user to root. root in general is to be avoided
or if you have a terminal open you can run: sudo -i
i always use the nvidia vdpau ppa and install nvidia-glx-185  works perfectly :)
how do i do that in terminal
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:nvidia-vdpau/ppa; sudo apt-get update; sudo apt-get install nvidia-glx-185
and is this the latest drivers for nivida 8800 gts 512 videocard
i think it has some weird 256 driver i havent heard of, but it will give you the 195 driver
it'll work
apt-get install nivida-glx-185 cannot find package
so what do i do
theres this too: http://www.ubuntuupdates.org/ppas/27
i typed it in wrong its installing thanks ill report back if it works
np man :)
thats all i use, i dont use jockey. it seems to give me grief so I just dont bother with it
i dont understand why i cant install it graphically tho i used to be able to but now its messes up my graaphics
me too with my 6150 so I found a way around
this started to happan with 10.04
you wouldnt happan to know how to change the longin scrren with a custom gdm not just the background
i've used it since jaunty, works great
i do :)
http://maketecheasier.com/change-login-and-boot-screen-in-ubuntu-lucid/2010/05/13
hold that thought i just tried to enable effects and it asks me to install a video driver now?
I dont know what i should do now my grapghics are messing up now
you can always remove the nvidia packages and use the open driver
whats open drivers
the default driver is noveau in lucid, you were using that driver when you first installed
ya that worked but i want to enable appearance effects
that ppa is all i got dude
with that ppa does that install the driver becaus ewhen i did that and then try to enable effects it asked me to install drivers
did you see the dkms stae run?
i think ill try and run it agian after i unistall the drviers agian
could you send me those codes agian
you could try reinstalling dkms to make the kernel module build
what is dkms and send me the code to reinstall it thanks
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:nvidia-vdpau/ppa; sudo apt-get update; sudo apt-get install --reinstall nvidia-glx-185
so i have glx185 install but it still wont let me enable effects should i try and install the drivers off the nivida site manually
try: sudo nvidia-xconfig   then reboot
command not found
then something isn't right, the app is pulled down with the driver, as is nvidia-settings
its gives me an option of install nivida settings should i do that
sure, the driver doesn't sound installed though
its sais its install i tried to do the glx-185 and it said it was installed
i installed nvidia setting and it said when opening it you do not apear to be using the Nvidia x driver
how can i install this driver manually
could this be causing the problem
Working around bugs in the new kernel video architecture
worth a try
should i try to install the drviers manually of the nvida website
if so it tells be to stop x and all open gl programs how do i do that
so can you help me
thats all I got dude, you can remove the nvidia-glx-185 package as well as the other nvidia stuff and you should beok
185 works fine but it wont let me enable effects do you know how to stop x and all open gl programs
sudo /etc/init/gdm stop may do it
im trying something differnt i opened pagage manager and typed nvidia but i dont know what ones to install
i have an idea should i install 9.10 witch works for me and then just upgrade to 10.04 do you think that would work
can't see why not
so is that a yes you think it will work
makes sense, i'd say yes
ook ill do that. thats gona take a long time to instal ;/
well thanks for your help
is there a way to put 9.10 boot splash on 10.04
not sure there dude
will you please use the pastebin, you have flooded repeatedly and scrolling the channel is not helpful nor fair to other users
if you obey the floodbot instead of scrolling the channel to death then you won't have a problem
sorry ill use pastbin for now on
cool :)
can you ping 8.8.8.8?
how do you ping
same as in any OS you can name
i dont know how
open a terminal with CTRL+ALT+T then type: ping 8.8.8.8 -c 4   and hit enter
you never did a ping in windows before?
i typed that in put it did not ping it it just gave me options
ok try: ping 8.8.8.8    instead
it pinged fine i think sent 4 recieved 4

sounds like your DNS sucks then. If you run: gksudo gedit /etc/resolv.conf    delete ALL text and add this line:  nameserver 8.8.8.8   save the new file, close gedit and all browsers then retry the browser, see if it flys
